title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (South Bend, IN) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
This interview process was unreasonably long. Applied back in June, got one phone interview many weeks later. Waited month before hearing they were cancelling the position because their candidate pool dried up. Said I was a top candidate but that I would have to reapply once they reopened it. After reopening the position applied. Again waited weeks before hearing that they’d like to interview in person. Honestly this interview experience did not leave me with a good impression about Notre dame, quite the opposite in fact. 

Essentially, it took 4 months to get an in person interview with them which I did not go to.  I got fed up with waiting for so long and decided to take another offer. 

Not sure why ND moves so slowly for hiring but if you want to hire talent, there’s no way you can move slowly in today’s job market. If the rest of Notre dame’s interviews are this labored and drawn out, I would not recommend working for them. Take other offers and move on with your life!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Notre dame

title: Writer/Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN)
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by a recruiter who wanted to see if I was interested in this role, given the fact I'd applied for a similar role within the month prior, but for which I was rejected (likely on the basis of inadequate experience).

The recruiter contacted me about two days before the open writer/editor position's application deadline, so I felt a little pressured to apply in time.

The first interview was via phone with the recruiter, who asked questions about my applicable experience and why I wanted to work for the office in which the role was being filled. He also gave me a rundown of the timeline for the hiring process, which was greatly appreciated.

I was contacted for an in-person interview by the hiring manager within the same week as the phone screening. Once confirmed for the in-person interview, I was asked to preemptively complete a writing exercise and submit it prior to the on-campus interview. 

I went to campus for a half-day "marathon interview", during which I completed an editing exercise at 8 a.m., then met with a small group, then a large group, then another small group, and later taken to lunch by the close-knit team with which I would work each day.

It was a nice day, but I feel the 10-person, half-day-long process was a bit unnecessary for such an entry-level role.

I left feeling as though I'd been cross-examined or interrogated, rather than feeling as though I'd had many meaningful conversations about the role.

Unfortunately, this type of grueling hiring process is rampant throughout many institutions of higher education.

No offer yet, but it may take a few days for the team to get through other candidate interviews.
Interview Questions:
In terms of the writing exercise, what did you mean when you wrote [this specific sentence]? 

(The exercise was related to articulating the details of a visiting lecturer's research on a complex topic.)

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Before the interviews I was required to take Prove It! tests to show my competency in using MS Word and Excel. The tests were taken over the internet from my home computer. The interviews were in the Behavioral Model so each interviewer asked a set series of questions about past work experiences. I interviewed with the department Chairman, the office manager and two people from Human Resources. They were organized and very professional.
Interview Questions: How would I prioritize multiple priorities.

title: Customer Service Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief, asked about personality, and how well i work with people. The interview took about 15 minutes. quite simple. i got the job right away and started shortly after the interview. i liked working there i just couldn't make it work with my school schedule.
Interview Questions: What are your priorities?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and one of the professors was interested in my application. He asked for a phone call and I got the fellowship for PhD study and work as his research assistant.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my previous research.

title: Graduate Career Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame
Interview Descriptions: 3 individual appointments with individuals at the Director/Dean level over the course of two days.  The position is housed in Student Affairs, but is also supported financially by two additional departments.  Behavioral questions; looking for how one would make a decision, experience level at institution of higher learning, knowledge of the University and it's Catholic mission.
Interview Questions: Explain how you would handle a situation where a Ph.D. student in the English department has decided he/she does not want to pursue a faculty position as a final career choice and his/her advisor is not supportive of the decision.

title: Visiting Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: phone interview. I was called at some time. It was pretty relaxed guess it's because the position, visiting assistant professor. The HM was nice. Later I know they just lost one faculty so they really need to hire someone right away.
Interview Questions: just had 3 minutes conversation then provided offer.

title: Banquet Server Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process involved talking to the lead manager and mainly getting asked common sensical questions. There were a few behavioral questions involved but nothing too difficult. At the end of the interview I received a tour of the place. Afterwards they had me meet the team members that I would be working with. Later that day, I received a phone call saying I got the job.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would respond to a team member doing something that was not allowed.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (South Bend, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Just a Skype call. Nothing fancy. So I applied online, and got a call from the school. A professor came in and asked me some questions about my research. that's it.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your research.

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Difficult and multi-stage. Had phone screen with HR, another with a team of potential colleagues, then a day-long in-person round of interviews including a "vision" presentation to 20 senior people about what I would do in the job.
Interview Questions: With all your strategic experience, how would you really enjoy this job?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame
Interview Descriptions: It was part of my funding for my graduate program. I talked to different processors who had funding to hire research assistants and tried to see if their area is of interest to me. People were friendly and I was able to get what I wanted. They asked about the courses I took and my technical skills and experience with different softwares.
Interview Questions: what research ideas are you planning to work on?

title: Student Note Taker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: The Center's coordinator sent out an email to students taking the course about the available note taker position. The note taker's objective was to compile detailed notes of lectures and discussions for a student with disabilities, who was also taking the course. The notes would be sent to the coordinator every week. I emailed the coordinator about my interest in taking on the job and she offered me the position right away.
Interview Questions: When can you begin?

title: MBA One Year Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (South Bend, IN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Conducted over Skype. Pretty straightforward and my interviewer was very friendly. Market sizing case question- how many books were read this year? They pretty much just want to know your analytical process, not looking for a right answer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Was contacted within 3 weeks by HR to do a phone interview. Then 3 weeks after that did a phone interview with my boss then three weeks after that was flown to South Bend to interview with 4 people across the division.
Interview Questions: The questions weren't that difficult it was more the marathon of interviews for a whole day.

title: Waddicks Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame
Interview Descriptions: Applied via email to manager.  I was emailed back within a few days with schedule options, pay, and some of the responsibilities.  I had to sign some papers before I started working but overall the process was very simple and I was able to start working soon.
Interview Questions: No questions asked.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online, and received an e-mail inviting me for an initial phone interview 3 days later.  The phone interview was delayed, due to the interviewer forgetting to call me (I e-mailed them, after waiting for 45 minutes).  After that, I did another phone interview with the same person as the initial interview, plus two others.  Once I passed that interview, I was given a writing assignment which had to be completed in 24 hours.  Once I passed that phase, I did a Skype interview with two of the people from the second interview (and no additional people).  

Most of the questions asked during each interview were the same, and often more than once per interview.  The people conducting the interviews were not from HR, but rather the people I would be working for.  While they were very nice, the whole process seemed very redundant.

The total time from application to decision was approximately 2.5 weeks.
Interview Questions: Are you sure you'd be happy living in South Bend?

title: Associate Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had two phone interviews (an initial screening with HR then a call with the hiring manager), then an all-day in person interview. The in-person interview had different pairs or trios of people meeting with me for most of the day. It was draining, but everyone was friendly and the questions weren't difficult. Most of the people were fairly casual with the exception of the HR person who asked lots of standard interview type questions (what are your weaknesses, what would your current manager say about you, etc). Make sure to dress formal! This is not your average, casual university.
Interview Questions: Nothing was too out of the blue, they did ask some situation questions though (i.e. what would you do in this challenging situation, tell us about a difficult co-worker you've dealt with, etc.)

title: Language Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN)
Interview Descriptions: You must be referred by a professor of the language you hope to tutor in. After that, the professor had me go through a student paper with her as if she were a student being tutored. She made me point out the mistakes, correct pronunciation and grammar. I'm sure she assessed interviewees on friendliness, and ability to provide positive criticism.
Interview Questions: Some tricky grammar.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Boston, MA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: an initial interview with multiple professors in a hotel room at the ASSA annual meeting, and then within a few days (probably one week) after the ASSA meeting, they will invite several candidates for the fly outs
Interview Questions: Talk about your job market paper?

title: Caterer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (South Bend, IN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was rather easy. Everyone is extremely kind and helpful. Just use your people skills and you’ll be hired. The hiring manager is laid back, they always need people during football season and you can make a lot in tips there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for catering?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a bit stressful, knowing the history of the department you work in is helpful.
Interview Questions: What is your least favorite aspect of the department you are applying for?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Notre Dame
Interview Descriptions: send the application in December, and then receives the offer in Feb. No interview, unless you contact a faculty member.
Interview Questions: not really

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (South Bend, IN)
Interview Descriptions: Saw ~10 professors in the same day. A bit of stressful, but some professors were really friendly.
Interview Questions: What is a "contour problem"?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Worcester, MA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: They basically asked about my experience of the job and what am planning to do in the near future.The activities of daily living Such as bathing,grooming,exercises, companionship and so on....the interviewer also asked if I will remain there forever and I told her that I will not because alongside the road I might switch to nursing
Interview Questions: Wat I will do to make my resident happy

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Notre Dame
Interview Descriptions:
1. E-mail professors in your department, try to schedule a meeting to discuss research opportunities, sending your resume.
2. Meet with professors and learn about the opportunities they have available. Once they have agreed to meet with you it is pretty much a done deal, just don't go full retard.
3. Choose the one you like the best and start researching!
Interview Questions: No difficult or unexpected question, just be a normal person that you would be able to stand working with.

title: Assistant Librarian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Notre Dame
Interview Descriptions: email application, skype interview, no onsite
Interview Questions: why here

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate In Chemistry Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: My PhD advisor knew my postdoc advisor and got in contact that way.  The interview process consisted of 2 phone interviews.  The first was a get to know the other person, some career goals and basics about the project.  The second was a more indepth discussion of the project and how I could make an impact.
Interview Questions: Wanted to know technical skills.

title: Research Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I got this job because my PhD supervisor wanted me to keep working in the same project.
Before joining as a Research Assistant Professor in the Department of Engineering and Computer Science at the University of Notre Dame, I earned my Ph.D. in 2013 in the same department. My Ph.D. dissertation focused on ABMs, spatial modeling, and data warehouses.
Interview Questions: How long do you want to work as a RAP?

title: Swim Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Emailed, received answer, accepted. There isnt much to say about this position. If you have taught swim lessons before, you'll be fine. Just make sure you dont miss lessons with clients.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview followed by on campus full day interview with student panels, departmental interview, frequent collaborators, divisional team members, and associate Vice President. Mostly assessing your knowledge of the school, the position and the department. They are also checking for personality fit for the department and the team. Alumni and community interaction  is also key.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in the position.

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Initial communications were in person and the interview was scheduled and run through a government agency that sponsored the program.  The interview wasn't overly technical but required an explanation of skills and abilities more so than an explanation of the project itself.
Interview Questions: Questions regarding the intricate matter in the field of study

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: just phone interview
Interview Questions: technical problems

title: Summer Hall Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviews are done in a group setting. Basically the managers are looking for any red flags among the applicants. Management will facilitate a series of activities where you must work with your team in order to come up with responses. If you participate well and get along with the other applicants then you'll be fine.
Interview Questions: Questions were addressed to your team, so there wasn't really a situation where everyone was simultaneously stumped.

title: Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: After a phone interview with HR and a phone interview with the hiring supervisor, I had eight back-to-back one-hour interviews with eight different people across campus. It was too much.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Notre Dame

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: You fill out the online application. Following up is advised. Then the interview is scheduled and takes place sometimes within the next week or so. After that, you're notified if you've been hired, usually via email. It is sometimes necessary to follow up after the interview. The process is very straightforward and the staff is friendly and helpful. Hitting the hiring cycle and having good availability is also key.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tour guide?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (South Bend, IN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: it is through skype. I was informed days before. The process was quite smooth and nice. The professor was very understanding. Questions are also quite related with the research.
Interview Questions: why Notre Dame

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (South Bend, IN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: easy phone interview screening
Interview Questions: They asked how you would handle certain situations

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (South Bend, IN) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Thorough interviewing process, great candidates competing against you. Great people treat you well. Personal questions about your vision for the future, and what you want to get out of it
Interview Questions: What my vision for my future was

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Initially, I was contacted by several professors for phone interview. As a followup of the phone interviews, I was offered for on-site interview. The on-site interview was 6~7 hours long. During the time, I talked with four professors and 8~10 graduate students. After few days of the on-site interview, I got admission into Ph.D. program with a Graduate Research Assistant position.
Interview Questions: I was mainly asked about my research interests and my future goals.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: No formal interview process for the engineering graduate program. Online applications are available on the university website and test scores are to be submitted. The department gets back to you with an offer including financial support and tuition river for PhD programs.
Interview Questions: Q. What are research interests

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview

The phone interview was very professional. Questions were asked about my experience in the field. and overview was given on the position responsibilities it.took 40 minutes. no behavioral questions were asked.

Onsite interview

The interview lasted for full day., mostly 1:1 interviews with hiring faculty, other faculties, students and a presentation of my research work. Each interview consists of 30 minutes. I was picked up and dropped at the airport in time.
Pros : Overall the interview went pretty.
Cons:  Lack of cultural diversity was prominently noticeable.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience writing proposals?

title: Project Assistant, Northwestern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Chicago, IL) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: I found the positions listed on npo.net, got the phone interview.  The interviewer said that the position was already in the final interview stage but she would pass on my information to two hiring managers because another position not listed yet was opening up.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions ... What was your largest success in your past position?

title: IT Senior Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (South Bend, IN) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview was just with the hiring manager and his group which consisted of 2 other people. Questions were based basically on - whether you a a team player, leadership role, previous work experience.Very long- 1.1 is one day event. With all the different groups-functional and tecnical. . No technical questions asked.
Interview Questions: Describe one of the difficult situation you had experinced at work and how did you handle it?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (South Bend, IN) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: I have sent the application packet and my prof contacted me on phone
Interview Questions: no surprises

title: Senior Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening interview followed by a multi-person phone interview. Next was an in person interview with a group of 8 people where I was asked a lot of technical questions. The questions were a combination of do I know what I'm talking about and am I claiming I know things that I don't. After that it was a lunch meeting with the whole staff and a few other meeting with VIP's for the department. These last meeting were basically to make sure I wasa good cultural fit.
Interview Questions: What are you passionate about?

title: Copywriter Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (South Bend, IN) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: I met with a group of management from my potential group. They were very friendly and inquisitive and made me feel as if I would fit in well. I was treated very respectfully and have since kept in touch with a few of those who interviewed me.
Interview Questions: Why do you believe you would be an ideal candidate?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Notre Dame (Notre Dame, IN) in Aug 2008
Interview Descriptions: There was only one interview, lasting about half of the day.  It was about half group and half 1:1, also including a lunch with the entire team.  There was nothing in particular that stood out as unusual or difficult.
Interview Questions: Nothing was extraordinarily unexpected or difficult.  Detail-orientation was emphasized as a point of necessity.
